list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The angler cast his line into the river

list_definition.definition: to get rid of; to take off
to shape (metal etc) by pouring into a mould/mold

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Metal is melted before it is cast.

list_definition.definition: to give a part in a play etc to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was cast as Lady Macbeth.

list_definition.definition: to select the actors for (a film etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The director is casting (the film) tomorrow.
I cast my vote for the younger candidate.
At his third cast he caught a fish.
The doctor put a plaster cast on her broken leg.
The hot metal is poured into a cast.

list_definition.mean_english: sự bố trí các vai diễn
list_definition.definition: the complete set of actors in a play, opera etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the whole cast of the play.

list_definition.definition: something that is ejected by certain animals, eg the earthworm

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: worm casts all over the grass.
